review: Just what I was looking for! For my husband's birthday, I bought Chromecast in the hopes of mirroring (called "Casting") my Android phone or tablet to our TV screens so that we could watch a variety of things together. For the unbelievable $35 price tag, it promised that I could do just that without any other equipment.We decided to try it out that night only to find out to my complete chagrin that neither my tablet nor my phone could mirror because apparently only a handful of Android products were spec'ed for it at the time. I was so embarrassed because I had read so carefully about it to ensure it would work, but it turned out that while the Samsung Galaxy S5 was capable, the S5 ACTIVE (which I own) was not. Disheartened, I took to the internet to find that Google was planning on rolling out more updates to accommodate other phones, so I held out hope.Several weeks ago, for a lark, I searched again to see if my compatibility had changed, and indeed it had! I opened up Chromecast, and BAM! there was my screen with everything on it right there on our flatscreen. I played a game, some videos, scrolled through pictures, all with only minor lag. It is responsive to screen rotation, so make sure you flip your phone accordingly to enjoy your mirrored screen.As long as you have a USB/HDMI input on your TV, you can use Chromecast with any TV. We use it downstairs and upstairs. It's great for watching the WWE network on our TV in our bedroom which does not have the Playstation or for streaming Amazon movies without having to move a muscle.I love this little dongle x1000. If your phone isn't compatible yet, don't fret! Wait a few months, and you could just be in luck!
